channel.title: Download Simba Free Here!
channel.description:
You can always find the latest version of Simba for all supported operating systems here:
Stable (git master branch): http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/ Unstable (git simba-next branch, bleeding edge, may or may not have bugs): http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Next/lastSuccessfulBuild/ Lape Integration (finally an attempt at a cross-platform script engine): http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Lape/lastSuccessfulBuild/
If you don't know what to download, you will want this one: Installer: http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe 7zip archive: http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.i386-win32.7z
These are built automatically when changes are made and are triggered by a git post-commit hook from github.
Here is a description of the windows installers: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe]SimbaInstaller.i386-win32[/url] - For 32-bit windows, if you are unsure, this is what you want. [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.x86_64-win64.exe]SimbaInstaller.x86_64-win64[/url] - For 64-bit windows, scripting engine doesn't work for this yet.
Here is a description of the 7zip archive files: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.i386-win32.7z]Simba.i386-win32[/url] - For 32-bit windows, if you are unsure, this is what you want. [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.x86_64-win64.7z]Simba.x86_64-win64[/url] - For 64-bit windows, scripting engine doesn't work for this yet. [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.i386-linux.7z]Simba.i386-linux[/url] - For 32-bit Linux, if you run Linux, you probably want this one. [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.x86_64-linux.7z]Simba.x86_64-linux[/url] - For 64-bit Linux.
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.all-in-one.7z]Simba.all-in-one[/url] - If you run multiple operating systems, this is the package for you, it contains all 4 of the above binaries in it, so you can run it from the same folder without rebooting into a particular OS.
You need the free utility [url=http://www.7-zip.org/download.html]7zip[/url] to extract the above files, simply extract the entire archive into a folder and run Simba from there.
The files linked to above are from the master branch and should be stable. Have fun!
If you want the 'official' stable version (currently Win32 only) then go here: http://wizzup.org/simba/
If you would like to look at the source code of Simba, refer to the git repo here: https://github.com/MerlijnWajer/Simba

item.title: Download Simba Free Here!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

glh5:

How to install the linux version (64 bit)? Does simba use wine?

The 32-bit windows Simba works well under WINE, and currently, to auto under Linux you will need to install it that way along with a 32-bit windows java installation. To test out any Linux version, just extract the files from the archive and run them, but the script engine doesn’t work too well under Linux yet.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @glh5 glh5

How to install the linux version (64 bit)? Does simba use wine?

Hehe, no problem, I just thought it was funny. It actually works very well under WINE.

item.title: Download Simba Free Here!
item.dc:creator: @mastaraymond mastaraymond
item.description:
@mastaraymond wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:360281”]I have ditched my old auto-build script in favor of Jenkins. I also build SMART and the other plugins automatically there as well, and if you find something else I should automatically build, let me know.

You can find all the good stuff here:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/

edit:
I just hacked up support to also automatically produce the windows installer that Wizzup usually provides:

Win32:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe

But I also create an installer for the 64-bit windows version:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.x86_64-win64.exe

Also shame on Wizzup (joking :P) for using a closed-source, windows-only windows installer generator. Here is how I do it on Linux:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/old_simba/make_tools/iss.sh

@Wizzup, I notice it doesn’t include quite a few things, like no test scripts, no fonts, no plugins, do you want to change it to do that? If so, I use your setup.iss, so just make the changes, push the commit, and the build will use it automatically.

I’d like someone on windows to actually test the installer to make sure it works just like Wizzup’s and report back, if you would, thanks in advance. :D[/quote]
I chose the closed-source windows installer, woops!

Read full topic

item.title: Download Simba Free Here!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I have ditched my old auto-build script in favor of Jenkins. I also build SMART and the other plugins automatically there as well, and if you find something else I should automatically build, let me know.

You can find all the good stuff here:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/

edit:
I just hacked up support to also automatically produce the windows installer that Wizzup usually provides:

Win32:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe

But I also create an installer for the 64-bit windows version:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.x86_64-win64.exe

Also shame on Wizzup (joking :P) for using a closed-source, windows-only windows installer generator. Here is how I do it on Linux:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/old_simba/make_tools/iss.sh

@Wizzup, I notice it doesn’t include quite a few things, like no test scripts, no fonts, no plugins, do you want to change it to do that? If so, I use your setup.iss, so just make the changes, push the commit, and the build will use it automatically.

I’d like someone on windows to actually test the installer to make sure it works just like Wizzup’s and report back, if you would, thanks in advance.

Read full topic

item.title: Download Simba Free Here!
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Moparisthebest:

My automatic version now includes irokiplugin, skyplugin, and SMART for all operating systems. I still don’t know if SMART will work with 64-bit windows or not, so it would be good if someone could test it out.

I’m on it.

Edit: Just throwing these out here

Loading extension C:\Users\Blake\Downloads\Simba.x86_64-win64.2010-09-21_22_00\Extensions\reflection.sex Extension Enabled From now on, you shall be alerted as to when your Reflection is out of date! Error in Simba extension (Reflection Updater): Could not call proc Loading extension C:\Users\Blake\Downloads\Simba.x86_64-win64.2010-09-21_22_00\Extensions\srl.sex Extension Enabled From now on, you shall be alerted as to when your SRL is out of date! Error in Simba extension (SRL Updater): Could not call proc
Happened before I tried to run a script (no SMART).

Manually added SRL and Reflection to my includes, ran a script using SMART (Something Fighter)

So I downloaded libgcc_s_sjlj-1.dll, then libstdc+±6.dll is missing, so I got that too but sadly

Exception in Script: Error loading plugin C:\Users\Blake\Downloads\Simba.x86_64-win64.2010-09-21_22_00\Plugins\libsmart.dll

Read full topic

item.title: Download Simba Free Here!
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

I see it also includes the required Extension folders and such. Nifty!

Currently I would really call Win32 the only ``supported’’ operating system in the sense that it doesn’t have unknown (or known, not easily fixable) bugs. I don’t think the Extensions to Simba work on Linux because PascalScript is not working too well there just yet. (It does work in WINE…) A mac version is also in development.

If you ever find yourself in need of an installer for Simba, you can find it at http://wizzup.org/simba/
It will most likely not be the very latest version. It would just like to state that there is no guarantee that all the nightly builds just work''. So ultimately if you want astable’’ tool you’d be best off getting the installer and then allow Simba to update itself to the latest stable Simba version.

Source at: http://git.villavu.com/simba.git/

Awesome to see Simba forums here!

Read full topic

item.title: Download Simba Free Here!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can always find the latest version of Simba for all supported operating systems here:

Stable (git master branch):
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/
Unstable (git simba-next branch, bleeding edge, may or may not have bugs):
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Next/lastSuccessfulBuild/
Lape Integration (finally an attempt at a cross-platform script engine):
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Lape/lastSuccessfulBuild/

If you don’t know what to download, you will want this one:
Installer:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe
7zip archive:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/Simba_Stable/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/Simba.i386-win32.7z

These are built automatically when changes are made and are triggered by a git post-commit hook from github.

Here is a description of the windows installers:
SimbaInstaller.i386-win32 - For 32-bit windows, if you are unsure, this is what you want.
SimbaInstaller.x86_64-win64 - For 64-bit windows, scripting engine doesn’t work for this yet.

Here is a description of the 7zip archive files:
Simba.i386-win32 - For 32-bit windows, if you are unsure, this is what you want.
Simba.x86_64-win64 - For 64-bit windows, scripting engine doesn’t work for this yet.
Simba.i386-linux - For 32-bit Linux, if you run Linux, you probably want this one.
Simba.x86_64-linux - For 64-bit Linux.

Simba.all-in-one - If you run multiple operating systems, this is the package for you, it contains all 4 of the above binaries in it, so you can run it from the same folder without rebooting into a particular OS.

You need the free utility 7zip to extract the above files, simply extract the entire archive into a folder and run Simba from there.

The files linked to above are from the master branch and should be stable. Have fun!

If you want the ‘official’ stable version (currently Win32 only) then go here:
http://wizzup.org/simba/

If you would like to look at the source code of Simba, refer to the git repo here:

GitHub

MerlijnWajer/Simba

Simba is a program used to repeat certain (complicated) tasks. Typically these tasks involve using the mouse and keyboard. Simba is programmable, which means you can design your own logic and steps...

Read full topic
